author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 15
text:
Tech 2.0 
Starting Thursday, Yahoo users will be able to sign on to a mail system that effectively eliminates the need for a password. The Yahoo Account Key is mainly for smartphone users, but people with alternative e-mail addresses can take advantage of it as well. Page C2 
Yes! and d’oh! 
Uber has had a mixed blessing of a week. On the good side: Uber has announced that it will try to help missing children by passing along Amber Alerts to its drivers. On the not-so-good side, Gawker reported that the San Francisco ride-hailing company inadvertently leaked driver’s licenses and other sensitive documents for almost 1,000 drivers.
Hot now 
Just after The Chronicle reported that momentum is growing among Bay Area restaurants to do away with tipping — you might not save money, though, because you’d have a bigger price up front — a prominent New York restaurateur is dropping tips and raising prices to give employees fairer wages. Danny Meyer says the change will apply to all 13 of his New York City spots, including the Modern , Union Square Cafe , Gramercy Tavern and Blue Smoke .
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
